title: 6 Easy Ways to Get Rid of Reels on Your Facebook Feed

steps.title: Go to the ESUIT page on the Chrome web store.
steps.content: Go to the ESUIT page on the Chrome web store. A surefire way to stop reels from appearing on Facebook is to use a browser extension. The ESUIT ADBlocker extension removes reels and sponsored posts from your Facebook feed. This extension is only available for Chrome and Opera. This extension will only work on a computer and doesn't work on your mobile Facebook app. It is, however, the best and only way to permanently get rid of reels on Facebook.

steps.title: Click the blue Add to Chrome button to install the extension.
steps.content: Click the blue Add to Chrome button to install the extension. On Opera, the button will say Add to Opera .

steps.title: Click the ESUIT extension icon in your extension tray.
steps.content: Click the ESUIT extension icon in your extension tray. The icon is a blue-to-purple gradient with an icon of a shield.

steps.title: Ensure "remove Reels" is toggled on .
steps.content: Ensure "remove Reels" is toggled on . This will block reels from appearing on your Facebook feed.

steps.title: Refresh your Facebook page.
steps.content: Refresh your Facebook page. If you scroll through your feed, you will see some text that says "Removed Reels" where one of the reels posts would have been without the extension installed.

steps.title: Log into the Facebook website on your web browser.
steps.content: Log into the Facebook website on your web browser. If you aren't logged in, enter your login information and click Log In to do so now. [1] X Research source This method won't permanently remove reels, but it will make them appear less on your feed. If you want to remove contact with a Facebook user entirely, consider blocking them instead. You can always unblock a user later.

steps.title: Find a reel.
steps.content: Find a reel. Scroll down your timeline to find a reel. You'll see Reels and short videos as the header. If you aren't on your timeline, click the Facebook icon in the top-left corner.

steps.title: Click ••• .
steps.content: Click ••• . This will be in the top-right corner of the reel. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Click Hide.
steps.content: Click Hide . By clicking Hide , you'll begin to see fewer reels. You can repeat this method for any reels you see. You can also hide ads on Facebook .

steps.title: Open the Facebook app on your mobile device.
steps.content: Open the Facebook app on your mobile device. This is the white f with a blue background. Facebook is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store . This method won't permanently remove reels, but it will make them appear less on your feed. If you aren't logged in, enter your login information and tap Sign In to do so now.

steps.title: Find a reel.
steps.content: Find a reel. Scroll down your timeline to find a reel. You'll see Reels and short videos as the header. If you aren't on your timeline, tap Home in the bottom-left corner.

steps.title: Tap ••• .
steps.content: Tap ••• . This will be in the top-right corner of the reel. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Hide.
steps.content: Tap Hide . By tapping Hide , you'll begin to see fewer reels. You can repeat this method for any reels you see.

steps.title: Log into the Facebook website on your web browser.
steps.content: Log into the Facebook website on your web browser. If you aren't logged in, enter your login information and click Log In to do so now. This method will stop videos from autoplaying on your feed.

steps.title: Click your profile picture.
steps.content: Click your profile picture. This is located at the top-right corner. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Click Settings & Privacy.
steps.content: Click Settings & Privacy . A new window will open.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . This will be next to a cog icon.

steps.title: Click Videos.
steps.content: Click Videos . You can find this on the left side panel, at the very bottom.

steps.title: Click On and select Off.
steps.content: Click On and select Off . This drop-down menu can be found to the right of Autoplay videos . You can also adjust the default video quality, captions, captions display, and video default volume. Videos will now be paused on your feed. To play them, click the video or the play button.

steps.title: Open the Facebook app on your mobile device.
steps.content: Open the Facebook app on your mobile device. This is the white f with a blue background. This method will stop videos from autoplaying on your feed.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . This will open the menu. On iOS, this will be at the bottom-right corner. On Android, this will be at the top-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Settings & privacy.
steps.content: Tap Settings & privacy . You may need to scroll down to find this option.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . This will be at the top of the menu.

steps.title: Tap Media.
steps.content: Tap Media . You can find this below Language and region .

steps.title: Tap Never Autoplay Videos.
steps.content: Tap Never Autoplay Videos . This will fill the bubble. Videos will now be paused on your feed. To play them, tap the video.

steps.title: Log into the Facebook website on your web browser.
steps.content: Log into the Facebook website on your web browser. If you aren't logged in, enter your login information and click Log In to do so now. Use this method to remove reels from your own Facebook account. You can also hide your profile .

steps.title: Click your profile picture.
steps.content: Click your profile picture. This is located at the top-right corner. A drop-down menu will open. On mobile, tap the three lines icon for the menu.

steps.title: Click Settings & Privacy.
steps.content: Click Settings & Privacy . A new window will open.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . This will be next to a cog icon.

steps.title: Click Reels.
steps.content: Click Reels . You can find this below Stories .

steps.title: Adjust your visibility settings.
steps.content: Adjust your visibility settings. If you don't want others to share your reels, select No underneath Allow others to share your reels to their stories? On some devices, you may only see the Who can see this? header along with your current privacy setting. To adjust the default audience for your reels, select your current setting and select Public or Friends . You can also select Friends except… if you want to hide reels from certain friends. You'll need to search and enter the users you want to exclude. Similar to deleting comments or posts , if you need to delete a reel, click the three dots icon in the top-right corner of your reel. Click Delete .
